title: Lunafest Lexington
brief_description: 9th Annual Lunafest Lexington - an inspirational evening of short films by, for, and about women
description:
9th Annual Lunafest Lexington - an inspirational evening of short films by, for, and about women.


This year's film selections are sure to inspire! And your attendance will raise funds to support our services for survivors of intimate partner abuse.


Ticket sales begin March 15.


Invite a few friends for a wonderful evening out or purchase a couple of tickets for the perfect Mother's Day gift.


LUNAFEST, a traveling short film festival celebrating women

filmmakers, is brought to you by LUNABar.

title: Closing reception 'Sharing Time and Space'
brief_description: The contrasting styles of primitive sculptures, drawings and paintings by Paolo Dal Prá are displayed along with the detail oriented secular mandalas by Carleton Wing.
description:
Closing Reception and Gallery Hop

The contrasting styles of primitive sculptures, drawings and paintings by Paolo Dal Prá are displayed along with the detail oriented secular mandalas by Carleton Wing. Inspired by the art of Tuscany, Paolo Dal Prá (1943-2017) creates his sculpture in wood, paper and clay. Thriving on detail, Carleton Wing creates his secular mandalas from objects he finds in his studio, manipulating them digitally until there is no beginning or end. For a brief time, these two old friends will share time and space in the gallery.

title: Whiskey Bear Live with DJ David Austin
brief_description: We're excited to bring some of Lexington's favorite artists for the launch of Whiskey Bear Live
description:
We're excited to bring some of Lexington's favorite artists for the launch of Whiskey Bear Live. Join us every Saturday, grab dinner from one of your favorite local restaurants, enjoy a drink with us and settle in for an evening full of great live music.


David Austin is a local artist, musician and DJ. As part of Thank You for Coming to Our Parties, he's helped re-ignite Lexington's love of dancing with parties such as Higher.

description:
Blue Stallion Brewing Company is partnering with Institute 193 on Monday, May 21st, and are generously donating 10% of their proceeds from the day to support Institute 193's mission to preserve and document the cultural landscape of the contemporary American South.


Come by and grab a beer with us! 193 director, Paul, will be on site 4 - 7 PM. He'll have books, t-shirts, and information about what we do. Please come!

title: Altered Views
brief_description: ALTERED VIEWS explores the 21st century landscape. No longer romantic, sublime or grandiose, our 'landscape' is viewed primarily through the media of our screens, moving from blissed-out vistas to environmental traumas
description:
ALTERED VIEWS: Experiencing The Contemporary Landscape

Opening Fourth Friday

May 25th 6-9pm @ The Loudoun House


FREE to LAL members/students with valid I.D

$5 general public

Food and drinks by Sweet LiLu's with music by Volare String Quartet.


Special thanks to our generous sponsors:

Mediocre Creative

LAVA Systems/Security

LexArts

Walter Gross III



Curated by Alice Pixley Young, ALTERED VIEWS explores the 21st century landscape. No longer romantic, sublime or grandiose, our 'landscape' is viewed primarily through the media of our screens, moving from blissed-out vistas to environmental traumas. Our interest in understanding nature and landscape is often constrained to the poles of beauty or terror, with everyday views overlooked. 


Participating Artists: Katlyn Brumfield, Charles Ellis, Steven Foutch, Jr., Eric Kniss, Magnolia Laurie, Meredith Leich, Logan Marconi, Emily Hanako Momohara, Emily Moores, Rachel Rampleman, Erica Stoller, Tanya Synar, Travis Townsend, Lisa Young, C. Jacqueline Wood,Terry Berlier & Llewelynn Fletcher, Maidens of the Cosmic Body Runnning: Denise Burge, Lisa Siders, Jenny Ustick


Exhibition dates 5/25-7/29

Gallery hours are free and open the public

(Tues-Thurs: 10a-4p, Fri: 10a-8p, Sat-Sun: 1-4p)

title: Bird
brief_description: Continuing in the tradition of the 6 year run of Lyric Summer Film Series prior, Black Lens seeks to celebrate and honor the monumental achievements in black cinema over the years.
description:
Bird - June 8, 7 pm


The Lyric is pleased to announce our 'Black Lens: Summer Film Series.' From From June 1 to July 27 every Friday at 7:00 p.m. The Lyric will be showcasing a film that is free and open to the public. This particular film series celebrates the fourth African-American Academy Award Winner, Forest Whitaker. Whitaker is a testament to the slow-growth presence of diversity in Hollywood. 


Continuing in the tradition of the 6 year run of Lyric Summer Film Series prior, Black Lens seeks to celebrate and honor the monumental achievements in black cinema over the years. This celebration dually honors The Lyric's storied legacy as a movie house and roots in the Lexington community.

title: Excessive Realness
brief_description: A dance intensive geared toward LGTBQIA+ dancers and performing artists, has opened registration and is welcoming participants
description:
Excessive Realness, a dance intensive geared toward LGTBQIA+ dancers and performing artists, has opened registration and is welcoming participants!


The intensive takes place at the Pam Miller Downtown Arts Complex in Lexington, KY, Tuesday June 26th to Friday June 29th, 2018. Classes begin at 10am on Tuesday and the intensive ends with a performance, called The SPILL, on Friday evening. The performance is free and open to the public. 


Register NOW!


The intensive costs $150 total, plus a registration fee. This includes 12 classes, 3 roundtable discussions with artists, and priority seating for the performance. We have financial scholarships available. If you are in need of a financial scholarship, please contact us.


The Guest Artists, who will both teach and perform at the intensive, are:


Ya-Ya Fairley, 

teaching 'Disruptive Bodies: Performance Lab in Bodily Release and Resistance'


Kristi Faulkner (Kristi Faulkner Dance), 

teaching 'Falling & Rolling'


Ally Garcia, 

teaching 'Hip Hop' 


Anna Maynard, 

teaching 'Improvisation: An act of 'homing'


Donald C. Shorter Jr.,

teaching 'Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Masterclass'


We are very excited for all of the Guest Artists! 


This intensive is the first of its kind in the US and we hope that you will consider being apart of this amazing opportunity.


Saturday

June 30th is Lexington's Pride Festival, we hope that you can also stay for those festivities. Any questions or concerns can be answered by the Co-Directors Allison Blakeney (Allison.Blakeney@gmail.com) and Anthony Alterio (Anthony.m.alterio@gmail.com), or send them a message on the Excessive Realness Facebook Page.

title: Dennis Quaid & The Sharks at The Burl
brief_description: Harry Dean Stanton Fest is thrilled to welcome Dennis Quaid and the Sharks to The Burl
description:
Harry Dean Stanton Fest is thrilled to welcome Dennis Quaid and the Sharks to The Burl!


A decades-long friend of Harry Dean, Dennis Quaid formed the Sharks in the year 2000 after an impromptu decision to join Harry Dean on stage introduced him to his future band. That fortuitous moment began a musical partnership with Harry Dean's bassist/friend, Jamie James (Steppenwolf), which has lasted to this day. Dennis and Jamie are excited to perform at this year's festival in honor of their much loved and much missed friend, Harry Dean.


Doors at 9 pm

Show at 10 pm

title: The Handsome Family
brief_description: The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR
description:
The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR


The Handsome Family’s absorbing vision of decay and entropy is quietly unsettling and makes most other modern roots music seem like child’s play—MOTHER JONES


Words that in their everyday surrealism have no parallel in contemporary writing... Music that mines the deep veins of fatalism in the Appalachian voice — GREIL MARCUS


As songwriters it’s the eerie, ancestral voice of ‘Anonymous’ they ultimately resemble the most —CHICAGO READER


Through the Trees (1998)—10 essential Americana records of all time — MOJO

In the Air (2000) —One of the most important records of the 21st century — UNCUT 'Weightless Again'—100 best songs ever written about heartbreak— THE GUARDIAN, UK

title: George Clinton & the Parliament Funkadelic
brief_description: The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic
description:
The Lyric Theatre is pleased to announce George Clinton and the Parliament Funkadelic to hit the Lyric Theatre Stage on Thursday, August 23.


Tickets are set at $65 Advance $70 Day Of plus ticket fees. Individual tickets will go on sale to the public on Monday, April 30 at 2 pm.


Currently, you can purchase the 'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package. This package includes 2 Best Seats in the House, 2 Funk Fridays passes, 2 Lyric T-shirts, 2 Lyric Concession Drinks, and 2 $2 Popcorn Bags for just $100 plus ticket fees. 


'We Want The Funk' Ticket Package will be available only from Friday, April 20 to Friday, April 27 at 5 pm. Limited number of ticket packages available.
